intro: Danaidia, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Danaidia typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet. Its leaves are opposite, heart-shaped, and often have a velvety texture, adding to its ornamental appeal.
